name: Salesforce Data Cloud
description: Connects to Salesforce Data Cloud through JDBC to enable SQL-based querying, table discovery, and metadata retrieval...

metadata.readme_excerpt:
# salesforce-data-cloud-mcp-server-by-cdata
CData's Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server for Salesforce Data Cloud

:heavy_exclamation_mark: This project builds a read-only MCP server. For full read, write, update, delete, and action capabilities and a simplified setup, check out our [CData MCP Server for Salesforce Data Cloud](https://www.cdata.com/drivers/salesforcedc/download/mcp/). 
## Purpose
We created this read-only MCP Server to allow LLMs (like Claude Desktop) to query live data Salesforce Data Cloud supported by the [CData JDBC Driver for Salesforce Data Cloud](https://www.cdata.com/drivers/salesforcedc/jdbc/).

CData JDBC Driver connects to Salesforce Data Cloud by exposing them as relational SQL models.

This server wraps that driver and makes Salesforce Data Cloud data available through a simple MCP interface, so LLMs can retrieve live information by asking natural language questions â€” no SQL required.

## Setup Guide
1. Clone the repository:
      ```bash
      git clone https://github.com/cdatasoftware/salesforce-data-cloud-mcp-server-by-cdata.git
      cd salesforce-data-cloud-mcp-server-by-cdata
      ```
2. Build the server:
      ```bash
      mvn clean install
      ``` 
      This creates the JAR file: CDataMCP-jar-with-dependencies.jar
2. Download and install the CData JDBC Driver for {source}: [https://www.cdata.com/drivers/salesforcedc/download/jdbc](https://www.cdata.com/drivers/salesforcedc/download/jdbc/)
3. License the CData JDBC Driver:
    * Navig
